body: Is there a use case for configuring it separately from decimal separator?
I did not quite understand the question. My english is probably bad
You're setting both `GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL` and `MONETARY_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL` to the same value. Can there be a situation when these two need to have different value?

1)`GROUPING_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL` used with thousandSeparator, in my case it is ' ' 
2)`MONETARY_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL` used with decimalSeparator, in my case it is '.' 
Maybe your mean `DECIMAL_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL` and `MONETARY_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL`? 
If I set `DECIMAL_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL=MONETARY_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL = '.'`
Result
```
        echo(Yii::$app->formatter->asDecimal(123.45));//123.45
        echo(Yii::$app->formatter->asCurrency(123.45));//123.45 руб.
```
Without `MONETARY_SEPARATOR_SYMBOL` result will be 
```
        echo(Yii::$app->formatter->asDecimal(123.45));//123.45
        echo(Yii::$app->formatter->asCurrency(123.45));//123,45 руб.
```
Yeah. I've meant that. I suspect setting these separately may be required for non-Russian language.
Therefore, introducing separate monetary separator sounds like a good way to handle it.
@XPOHOC269 how about preparing a pull request to speed things up?
